column4: Hey guys, I'm trying to compile something first time around, I have read info pertaining it but can not get it to work right. First, can someone explain ./configure? When I "./configure" I get "./configure: No such file or directory"
I'm there..
some programs don't use the ./configure script. There should be an INSTALL/README file in the archive that expains how to compile and install
yup (if you make install then the files will be installed into predetermined locations)
a make will just compile the app in the pwd
not sure about those various make commands....the package should document em
are you on fiesty?
you can always tried the old, tested, and tru make then
not at the moment. Are you having problems pulling in postfix packages?
I'm getting various "warning: incompatible implicit declaration of built-in function"
sorry, wrong person
don't worry about those
the only thing you need to worry about is an *ERROR*, *warnings* are ok...it referers to the coding of the actual app
are you using the period there? ./glnostromo?
.glnostromo command not found
./glnostromo: No such file or directory
if you look around that directory...do you see the glnostromo directory?
the glnostromo file, sorry
no... only nostromo
you could try ./nostromo then
k, just did, and I guess it ran but it didn't do anything
but if the executable is supposed to be called glnostromo...they may have been an issue during compilation
will you dl this and install it plz? so you can see for yourself so I can better understand? it's basically a usb2key thing so I can use gamepad, something I really need
